_header: O Lobe Lobe on thy soul God have mercy
Note:
See Schoeck (1951)
XSchoeck, R. J. “A Fool to Henry VIII at Lincoln’s Inn: ‘Lobbe, the Kynges Foole’.” Modern Language Notes 66 (1951): 506-9.
Title(s): ‘The Epytaphye of Lobe, the Kynges foole’
_description: ‘The Epytaphye of Lobe, the Kynges foole’ [to Henry VIII] — seven stanzas rhyme royal

BodRawC813.First Lines:
O lobbe Lobe on thy sowle God haue mercyeFor as Petre ys
                        princeps apostolorum…
BodRawC813.Last Lines:
…God amend alle folys that thynke themselfe noneFor many be
                    alyve thouȝhe Lobe be gone
BodRawC813.Note:
Transcribed from Swain (1932)
XSwain,  Barbara. 
             Fools and Folly During the Middle Ages and the Renaissance.
         New York: Columbia University Press, 1932, 56-7.
